The phenomenon of perfect diamagnetism in superconductors is called the Meissner effect, after the name of its discoverer.

Superconducting magnets can be gainfully exploited in variety of situations, for example, for running magnetically levitated superfast trains.

### 5.5.2 Paramagnetism

Paramagnetic substances are those which get weakly magnetised when placed in an external magnetic field. They have tendency to move from a region of weak magnetic field to strong magnetic field, i.e. they get weakly attracted to a magnet.
summary: In the context of 'Paramagnetism', the text explains that paramagnetic substances become weakly magnetised when placed in an external magnetic field and have a tendency to move from an area of weaker to stronger magnetic field.
